argan-oil.name: Argan oil
argan-oil.description: Oil pressed from argan tree (Argania spinosa) kernels. Produces soft bars with highly conditioning properties.

sourcing.productionMethod: Cold-pressed or mechanically extracted from Argania spinosa kernels. Traditional production involves hand-cracking nuts and grinding kernels.
sourcing.supplyChainNotes: Morocco is the sole commercial producer. UNESCO-protected argan forest ecosystem.

environmental: Argan forest ecosystem under pressure from climate change and overgrazing
social: Fair compensation for women's cooperatives varies widely
Traditional knowledge appropriation concerns
ethicalConcerns.notes: Women's cooperatives have historically provided income to rural Berber women. Look for cooperative-sourced products with fair trade certification.

references.section: Argan oil (CID 11848929)

apricot-kernel-oil.name: Apricot kernel oil
apricot-kernel-oil.description: Oil pressed from apricot (Prunus armeniaca) kernels. Produces soft bars with highly conditioning properties.

sourcing.productionMethod: Cold-pressed from apricot kernels, a byproduct of the dried fruit and fresh fruit industries.

ethicalConcerns.notes: Generally low concern as kernels are a byproduct of fruit processing. Supply chain is well-established.

references.section: PMC9905367: Apricot kernel characterization, oil extraction, and its utilization: a review

avocado-oil.name: Avocado oil
avocado-oil.description: Oil pressed from avocado (Persea americana) fruit. Produces soft bars with highly conditioning properties.

sourcing.productionMethod: Mechanically pressed from avocado fruit flesh, often from fruit unsuitable for fresh market.
sourcing.supplyChainNotes: Mexico produces ~30% of world supply. Oil can be extracted from cosmetically imperfect fruit.

environmental: High water consumption (estimated 320 litres per fruit)
Deforestation for new plantations in Mexico and Peru
social: Cartel involvement in Mexican avocado regions (Michoacán)
Labour exploitation reported in some regions
ethicalConcerns.notes: Mexican sourcing carries higher social risk. Consider sourcing from regions with better oversight like Kenya or California.

references.section: PMC6600360: Avocado Oil: Characteristics, Properties, and Applications

babassu-oil.name: Babassu oil
babassu-oil.description: Oil pressed from babassu palm (Attalea speciosa) nuts. Produces very hard bars with abundant, bubbly lather and high cleansing.

sourcing.productionMethod: Hand-harvested nuts cracked and cold-pressed. Wild-harvested from native babassu forests in northeastern Brazil.
sourcing.supplyChainNotes: Endemic to Brazil. Collected by traditional 'quebradeiras de coco' (nut breakers), predominantly women.

environmental: Native babassu forests under pressure from cattle ranching and soy expansion
social: Important income source for rural communities
Land rights disputes affect harvester access
ethicalConcerns.notes: Considered a sustainable palm oil alternative when ethically sourced. Supports traditional livelihoods. Look for community-sourced products.

references.section: CXS 210-1999: Section 2.1.2 Babassu Oil, Table 1 Fatty Acid Composition

beef-tallow.name: Beef tallow
beef-tallow.description: Rendered beef fat. Adds moderate hardness with stable, creamy lather.

sourcing.productionMethod: Rendered from beef fat, a byproduct of the meat industry. Fat is heated to separate from connective tissue.
sourcing.supplyChainNotes: Byproduct of beef processing. Quality varies by cattle diet (grass-fed vs grain-fed).

environmental: Cattle ranching contributes to deforestation (especially in Amazon)
social: Animal welfare concerns in industrial farming
ethicalConcerns.notes: Byproduct utilization reduces waste. Consider sourcing from grass-fed, pasture-raised, or local small-scale farms. Brazilian beef linked to deforestation.

references.section: CXS 211-1999: Section 2.4 Edible Tallow, Table 1 Fatty Acid Ranges

black-cumin-seed-oil.name: Black cumin seed oil (Nigella sativa)
black-cumin-seed-oil.description: Oil pressed from black cumin (Nigella sativa) seeds. Produces soft bars with highly conditioning properties.

sourcing.productionMethod: Cold-pressed from Nigella sativa seeds. Traditional cultivation in Middle East and South Asia.

political: Syrian conflict has disrupted traditional supply chains
ethicalConcerns.notes: Low environmental impact crop. Syrian sourcing may be affected by ongoing conflict.

references.section: PMC10975171: Variation in the Composition and Quality of Nigella sativa L. Seed Oils

camellia-seed-oil.name: Camellia seed oil (tea seed oil)
camellia-seed-oil.description: Oil pressed from camellia (Camellia oleifera) seeds. Produces soft bars with highly conditioning properties.

sourcing.productionMethod: Cold-pressed from Camellia oleifera seeds. Traditional oil in East Asian cuisine and cosmetics.

ethicalConcerns.notes: Well-established crop with low environmental impact. Perennial tree crop that provides habitat.

references.section: Tea seed oil / Camellia oil (CID 6850744)

canola-oil-low-erucic-rapeseed.name: Canola oil (low erucic rapeseed)
canola-oil-low-erucic-rapeseed.description: Oil pressed from low-erucic rapeseed (Brassica napus). Produces soft bars with highly conditioning properties.

sourcing.productionMethod: Mechanically pressed or solvent-extracted from rapeseed. Large-scale industrial agriculture.
sourcing.supplyChainNotes: Canada is the world's largest producer and exporter.

environmental: Majority of North American canola is GMO
ethicalConcerns.notes: Non-GMO and organic options available but at higher cost. Conventional canola widely uses glyphosate.

references.section: CXS 210-1999: Section 2.1.12 Rapeseed Oil (Low Erucic Acid), Table 1

castor-oil.name: Castor oil
castor-oil.description: Oil pressed from castor (Ricinus communis) beans. Produces soft bars with abundant lather and highly conditioning properties.

sourcing.productionMethod: Cold-pressed or solvent-extracted from castor beans. India produces ~90% of global supply.

social: Child labour reported in some Indian production regions
Exposure to toxic ricin during processing poses worker safety risks
ethicalConcerns.notes: Seeds contain toxic ricin which is removed during processing. Look for suppliers with verified labour practices.

references.section: PMC5015816: Castor Oil: Properties, Uses, and Optimization of Processing Parameters in Commercial Production

cocoa-butter.name: Cocoa butter
cocoa-butter.description: Butter extracted from cocoa (Theobroma cacao) beans. Produces hard bars with stable, creamy lather.

sourcing.productionMethod: Hydraulic pressing of roasted cocoa beans. Byproduct of chocolate production.
sourcing.supplyChainNotes: West Africa produces ~70% of world cocoa. Complex multi-tier supply chain.

environmental: Deforestation for cocoa plantations in West Africa
social: Child labour and forced labour documented in West African cocoa farming
Farmer poverty despite high global demand
ethicalConcerns.notes: Cocoa industry has significant child labour concerns. Fair Trade certification addresses farmer income and labour standards.

references.section: CXS 86-1981: Standard for Cocoa Butter

coconut-oil-76.name: Coconut oil (76)
coconut-oil-76.description: Oil pressed from coconut (Cocos nucifera) meat. Produces very hard bars with abundant, bubbly lather and high cleansing. Coconut is classified as a tree nut allergen.

sourcing.productionMethod: Cold-pressed or expeller-pressed from dried coconut meat (copra). Unrefined (virgin) vs refined options available.
sourcing.supplyChainNotes: Philippines and Indonesia dominate global production. Small-holder farmers produce most coconuts.

social: Fair wage concerns for small-holder farmers
Coconut farmers often receive low prices for harvest
ethicalConcerns.notes: Coconut palms are generally sustainable perennial crops. Fair trade addresses farmer income inequality.

references.section: CXS 210-1999: Section 2.1.3 Coconut Oil, Table 1 Fatty Acid Composition

coconut-oil-92.name: Coconut oil (92)
coconut-oil-92.description: Hydrogenated coconut (Cocos nucifera) oil. Produces very hard bars with abundant, bubbly lather and high cleansing. Coconut is classified as a tree nut allergen.

sourcing.productionMethod: Hydrogenated coconut oil processed to raise melting point. Additional industrial processing step.
sourcing.supplyChainNotes: Same source regions as regular coconut oil.

social: Fair wage concerns for small-holder farmers
ethicalConcerns.notes: Same sourcing concerns as regular coconut oil. Hydrogenation adds industrial processing.

references.section: CXS 210-1999: Section 2.1.3 Coconut Oil (hydrogenated variant)

cupuacu-butter.name: Cupuacu butter
cupuacu-butter.description: Butter extracted from cupuacu (Theobroma grandiflorum) seeds. Adds moderate hardness with stable, creamy lather.

sourcing.productionMethod: Cold-pressed from cupuacu seeds. Native to Amazon basin, related to cocoa.
sourcing.supplyChainNotes: Endemic to Brazilian Amazon. Often wild-harvested or from agroforestry systems.

social: Supports indigenous and local communities when sustainably sourced
ethicalConcerns.notes: Can support sustainable Amazon livelihoods when sourced from agroforestry or wild-harvest programs.

references.section: Cupuacu butter (CID 6857658)

cottonseed-oil.name: Cottonseed oil
cottonseed-oil.description: Oil pressed from cottonseeds (Gossypium). Produces soft bars with highly conditioning properties.

sourcing.productionMethod: Solvent-extracted or expeller-pressed from cottonseeds, a byproduct of cotton textile industry.

environmental: Cotton is one of the most pesticide-intensive crops
social: Forced labour documented in Uzbekistan and Xinjiang cotton production
Child labour in some regions
political: Xinjiang cotton linked to Uyghur forced labour concerns
ethicalConcerns.notes: Conventional cotton production has significant environmental and social concerns. Organic and Fair Trade options address many issues.

references.section: Cottonseed oil (CID 6850758)

deer-tallow.name: Deer tallow
deer-tallow.description: Rendered deer fat. Adds moderate hardness with stable, creamy lather.

sourcing.productionMethod: Rendered from deer fat, typically a byproduct of venison production from farmed or hunted deer.

social: Animal welfare varies by farming practices
ethicalConcerns.notes: Byproduct of venison industry. Wild-harvested deer from regulated hunting has lower environmental impact than farmed.

references.section: CXS 211-1999: Extrapolated from Edible Tallow specifications

duck-fat.name: Duck fat
duck-fat.description: Rendered duck fat. Adds moderate hardness with conditioning properties.

sourcing.productionMethod: Rendered from duck fat, a byproduct of duck meat and foie gras production.

social: Foie gras production involves force-feeding (gavage), banned in many jurisdictions
Animal welfare concerns in intensive duck farming
ethicalConcerns.notes: Foie gras-sourced fat has significant animal welfare concerns. Look for fat from non-gavage duck operations.

references.section: Duck fat composition

emu-oil.name: Emu oil
emu-oil.description: Rendered emu (Dromaius novaehollandiae) fat. Adds moderate hardness with conditioning properties.

sourcing.productionMethod: Rendered from emu fat, byproduct of emu farming for meat and leather.
sourcing.supplyChainNotes: Emus are native to Australia. US has significant farming operations.

social: Animal welfare concerns in intensive emu farming
ethicalConcerns.notes: Byproduct of emu farming. Quality and ethical standards vary by farm.

references.section: PMC9182831: Chemical Characterization and In Vivo Toxicological Safety Evaluation of Emu Oil

flaxseed-oil.name: Flaxseed oil (linseed)
flaxseed-oil.description: Oil pressed from flax (Linum usitatissimum) seeds. Produces soft bars with highly conditioning properties. High linolenic content; soap prone to DOS.

sourcing.productionMethod: Cold-pressed from flax seeds. Canada is the world's largest producer.

ethicalConcerns.notes: Low environmental impact crop. Can be grown in rotation with other crops, improving soil health.

references.section: Linseed oil (CID 5356420)

fractionated-coconut-oil-mct.name: Fractionated coconut oil (MCT)
fractionated-coconut-oil-mct.description: Fractionated coconut (Cocos nucifera) oil. Produces soft bars with minimal lather contribution. Coconut is classified as a tree nut allergen.

sourcing.productionMethod: Coconut oil fractionated to isolate medium-chain triglycerides (MCT). Industrial processing.

social: Same farmer income concerns as regular coconut oil
ethicalConcerns.notes: Additional industrial processing over regular coconut oil. Same sourcing concerns apply.

references.section: CID 9857063: Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride compound summary

goat-tallow.name: Goat tallow
goat-tallow.description: Rendered goat fat. Adds moderate hardness with stable, creamy lather.

sourcing.productionMethod: Rendered from goat fat, a byproduct of goat meat production.

social: Animal welfare varies by farming practices
ethicalConcerns.notes: Byproduct of goat meat industry. Goats have lower environmental impact than cattle. Often raised on small-scale farms.

references.section: CXS 211-1999: Extrapolated from Edible Tallow specifications

goose-fat.name: Goose fat
goose-fat.description: Rendered goose fat. Adds moderate hardness with conditioning properties.

sourcing.productionMethod: Rendered from goose fat, byproduct of goose meat and foie gras production.

social: Foie gras production involves force-feeding (gavage)
Animal welfare concerns in intensive farming
ethicalConcerns.notes: Similar concerns to duck fat. Foie gras-sourced fat has significant animal welfare concerns.

references.section: PMC6325401: Fatty acid composition of goose meat depending on genotype and sex

grapeseed-oil.name: Grapeseed oil
grapeseed-oil.description: Oil pressed from grape (Vitis vinifera) seeds. Produces soft bars with highly conditioning properties.

sourcing.productionMethod: Expeller-pressed or solvent-extracted from grape seeds, a byproduct of wine production.

ethicalConcerns.notes: Sustainable byproduct of wine industry. Upcycles waste material that would otherwise be discarded.

references.section: CXS 210-1999: Section 2.1.5 Grapeseed Oil, Table 1 Fatty Acid Composition

hazelnut-oil.name: Hazelnut oil
hazelnut-oil.description: Oil pressed from hazelnuts (Corylus avellana). Produces soft bars with highly conditioning properties. Tree nut allergen.

sourcing.productionMethod: Cold-pressed from hazelnuts. Turkey produces ~70% of world supply.

social: Child labour reported in Turkish hazelnut harvest
Migrant worker exploitation documented
ethicalConcerns.notes: Turkish hazelnuts have documented child labour and migrant worker concerns. Fair Trade certification helps address these issues.

references.section: Hazelnut oil (CID 6850741)

hemp-seed-oil.name: Hemp seed oil
hemp-seed-oil.description: Oil pressed from hemp (Cannabis sativa) seeds. Produces soft bars with highly conditioning properties. High linolenic content; soap prone to DOS.

sourcing.productionMethod: Cold-pressed from hemp seeds. Industrial hemp (low THC) is legal in most jurisdictions.

political: Legal status varies by jurisdiction due to cannabis association
ethicalConcerns.notes: Environmentally beneficial crop requiring few pesticides. Growing demand supports sustainable agriculture.

references.section: Hemp seed oil (CID 6850740)

high-oleic-sunflower-oil.name: High oleic sunflower oil
high-oleic-sunflower-oil.description: Oil pressed from high-oleic sunflower (Helianthus annuus) seeds. Produces soft bars with highly conditioning properties.

sourcing.productionMethod: Expeller-pressed or solvent-extracted from hybrid sunflower seeds bred for high oleic content.

political: Ukraine conflict has disrupted global sunflower oil supply (major producer)
ethicalConcerns.notes: Non-GMO high-oleic varieties developed through conventional breeding. Ukraine conflict affects supply and pricing.

references.section: CXS 210-1999: Section 2.1.19 Sunflowerseed Oil (High Oleic Acid), Table 1

illipe-butter.name: Illipe butter
illipe-butter.description: Butter extracted from illipe (Shorea stenoptera) seeds. Produces hard bars with stable, creamy lather.

sourcing.productionMethod: Extracted from Shorea stenoptera nuts, a Dipterocarp tree native to Borneo rainforests.
sourcing.supplyChainNotes: Wild-harvested from tropical rainforests. Trees cannot be cultivated commercially.

social: Supports indigenous forest communities when sustainably harvested
ethicalConcerns.notes: Wild-harvested from endangered rainforest habitat. Sustainable sourcing crucial for forest conservation.

references.section: Illipe butter / Shorea stenoptera fat

kokum-butter.name: Kokum butter
kokum-butter.description: Butter extracted from kokum (Garcinia indica) seeds. Produces hard bars with stable, creamy lather.

sourcing.productionMethod: Extracted from Garcinia indica seeds. Endemic to Western Ghats of India.
sourcing.supplyChainNotes: Wild-harvested from forests and cultivated in home gardens. Traditional Indian product.

environmental: Wild populations under pressure from habitat loss
social: Supports rural Indian communities
ethicalConcerns.notes: Endemic to India's Western Ghats biodiversity hotspot. Sustainable harvesting supports conservation.

references.section: PMC6859180: Evaluation model for cocoa butter equivalents based on fatty acid compositions and triacylglycerol patterns

kukui-nut-oil.name: Kukui nut oil
kukui-nut-oil.description: Oil pressed from kukui (Aleurites moluccanus) nuts. Produces soft bars with highly conditioning properties. High linolenic content; soap prone to DOS.

sourcing.productionMethod: Cold-pressed from kukui nuts. State tree of Hawaii. Traditional Polynesian use.
sourcing.supplyChainNotes: Hawaiian production supports local agriculture. Also grows wild across Pacific Islands.

social: Supports Hawaiian and Pacific Island communities
ethicalConcerns.notes: Traditional Hawaiian product. Local sourcing supports island economies and preserves cultural practices.

references.section: PMC10308387: Comprehensive Characterization of Kukui Nuts as Feedstock

macadamia-nut-oil.name: Macadamia nut oil
macadamia-nut-oil.description: Oil pressed from macadamia (Macadamia integrifolia) nuts. Produces soft bars with highly conditioning properties. Tree nut allergen.

sourcing.productionMethod: Cold-pressed from macadamia nuts. Native to Australian rainforests.

ethicalConcerns.notes: Well-established perennial crop. Australian and Hawaiian production generally have good labour standards.

references.section: PMC8151099: Comparative Study of Chemical Compositions and Antioxidant Capacities of Oils Obtained from 15 Macadamia Cultivars in China

mango-butter.name: Mango butter
mango-butter.description: Butter extracted from mango (Mangifera indica) seed kernels. Adds moderate hardness with stable, creamy lather.

sourcing.productionMethod: Extracted from mango seed kernels, a byproduct of mango fruit processing.

ethicalConcerns.notes: Sustainable byproduct of mango fruit industry. Upcycles waste material. India is world's largest mango producer.

references.section: PMC4995435: Mangifera sylvatica (Wild Mango): A new cocoa butter alternative

meadowfoam-oil.name: Meadowfoam oil
meadowfoam-oil.description: Oil pressed from meadowfoam (Limnanthes alba) seeds. Produces soft bars with minimal contribution to soap properties.

sourcing.productionMethod: Cold-pressed from Limnanthes alba seeds, a crop developed specifically for the oilseed industry.

ethicalConcerns.notes: Meadowfoam is primarily grown in the Pacific Northwest US as an alternative rotation crop. Supports local agriculture and does not compete with food crops.

references.section: PMC59139: Production of Fatty Acid Components of Meadowfoam Oil in Somatic Soybean Embryos
Biodiesel from meadowfoam: oxidative stability and unusual fatty acid composition

moringa-oil.name: Moringa oil (ben oil)
moringa-oil.description: Oil pressed from moringa (Moringa oleifera) seeds. Produces soft bars with highly conditioning properties.

sourcing.productionMethod: Cold-pressed or solvent-extracted from Moringa oleifera seeds.
sourcing.supplyChainNotes: Moringa is often promoted as a sustainable crop for developing regions due to drought tolerance.

ethicalConcerns.notes: Moringa cultivation supports smallholder farmers in tropical regions. The tree is fast-growing and drought-resistant, requiring minimal inputs.

references.section: PMC3931868: Quality characteristics and stability of Moringa oleifera seed oil of Indian origin

mustard-seed-oil.name: Mustard seed oil
mustard-seed-oil.description: Oil pressed from mustard (Brassica) seeds. Produces soft bars with highly conditioning properties.

sourcing.productionMethod: Cold-pressed or expeller-pressed from Brassica species seeds.

ethicalConcerns.notes: Traditional cooking oil in South Asia. Large-scale production in Canada uses low-erucic varieties.

references.section: PMC6717124: Physicochemical properties of cold pressed mustard oil

neem-oil.name: Neem oil
neem-oil.description: Oil pressed from neem (Azadirachta indica) seeds. Adds moderate hardness with conditioning properties. Raw oil has strong scent; mostly dissipates during saponification.

sourcing.productionMethod: Cold-pressed or solvent-extracted from Azadirachta indica seeds.

ethicalConcerns.notes: Neem trees are widely cultivated in South Asia and Africa. Traditional medicine and agricultural uses support local economies.

references.section: Neem oil (CID 6850750)
PMID 11171243: Variations in fatty acid composition of neem seeds from Rajasthan

olive-oil.name: Olive oil
olive-oil.description: Oil pressed from olives (Olea europaea). Produces soft bars with highly conditioning properties.

sourcing.productionMethod: Cold-pressed (extra virgin) or refined from Olea europaea fruit.
sourcing.supplyChainNotes: Mediterranean region dominates global production. Spain alone produces nearly half of world supply.

social: Seasonal migrant labour exploitation documented in some European harvests
ethicalConcerns.notes: Large-scale olive farming has environmental impacts in water-stressed Mediterranean regions. Premium extra virgin oils often support smaller producers.

references.section: CXS 33-1981: Standard for Olive Oils and Olive Pomace Oils, Table Fatty Acid Composition

olive-oil-pomace.name: Olive oil pomace
olive-oil-pomace.description: Oil extracted from olive (Olea europaea) pulp after first pressing. Produces soft bars with highly conditioning properties.

sourcing.productionMethod: Solvent-extracted from olive pulp remaining after first pressing, then refined.
sourcing.supplyChainNotes: Byproduct of virgin olive oil production. More cost-effective than virgin grades.

social: Seasonal migrant labour exploitation documented in some European harvests
ethicalConcerns.notes: Same sourcing concerns as virgin olive oil. Uses pulp byproduct that would otherwise be waste.

references.section: CXS 33-1981: Standard for Olive Oils and Olive Pomace Oils

palm-kernel-oil.name: Palm kernel oil
palm-kernel-oil.description: Oil pressed from palm (Elaeis guineensis) fruit seeds. Produces very hard bars with abundant, bubbly lather and high cleansing. Palm cultivation linked to deforestation and biodiversity loss (IUCN); consider RSPO-certified sources.

sourcing.productionMethod: Mechanically extracted from Elaeis guineensis kernel (seed), then refined.
sourcing.supplyChainNotes: Indonesia and Malaysia produce ~85% of global palm oil. Complex supply chains make traceability difficult.

environmental: Orangutan, tiger, and elephant habitat loss
Greenhouse gas emissions from peat fires
Biodiversity loss in Southeast Asian rainforests
social: Forced and child labour documented on plantations
Indigenous land rights violations
Unsafe working conditions reported
political: Land tenure conflicts with indigenous communities
ethicalConcerns.notes: Palm kernel oil shares all supply chain concerns with palm oil. RSPO certification addresses some concerns but has been criticized for weak enforcement. Identity Preserved or Segregated certifications provide better traceability than Mass Balance.

references.section: CXS 210-1999: Section 2.1.9 Palm Kernel Oil, Table 1 Fatty Acid Composition
Palm Oil and Biodiversity: A Situation Analysis
Why Sustainable Palm Oil Matters

palm-oil.name: Palm oil
palm-oil.description: Oil pressed from palm (Elaeis guineensis) fruit pulp. Adds moderate hardness with stable, creamy lather. Palm cultivation linked to deforestation and biodiversity loss (IUCN); consider RSPO-certified sources.

sourcing.productionMethod: Mechanically extracted from Elaeis guineensis fruit pulp (mesocarp), then refined.
sourcing.supplyChainNotes: Most widely produced vegetable oil globally. Indonesia and Malaysia produce ~85% of world supply.

environmental: Orangutan, tiger, and elephant habitat loss
Greenhouse gas emissions from peat fires
Biodiversity loss in Southeast Asian rainforests
social: Forced and child labour documented on plantations
Indigenous land rights violations
Unsafe working conditions reported
political: Land tenure conflicts with indigenous communities
ethicalConcerns.notes: Palm oil is the world's most consumed vegetable oil. RSPO certification is the primary standard but has limitations. Boycotts may push production to less regulated regions; certified sustainable sourcing is often recommended over avoidance.

references.section: CXS 210-1999: Section 2.1.8 Palm Oil, Table 1 Fatty Acid Composition
Palm Oil and Biodiversity: A Situation Analysis
Why Sustainable Palm Oil Matters

peanut-oil.name: Peanut oil (groundnut)
peanut-oil.description: Oil pressed from peanuts (Arachis hypogaea). Produces soft bars with highly conditioning properties. Peanut allergen.

sourcing.productionMethod: Expeller-pressed or solvent-extracted from Arachis hypogaea seeds.

ethicalConcerns.notes: Major global crop with established supply chains. China and India are dominant producers.

references.section: CXS 210-1999: Section 2.1.1 Arachis Oil (Peanut/Groundnut Oil)

pecan-oil.name: Pecan oil
pecan-oil.description: Oil pressed from pecans (Carya illinoinensis). Produces soft bars with highly conditioning properties. Tree nut allergen.

sourcing.productionMethod: Cold-pressed or expeller-pressed from Carya illinoinensis nuts.

ethicalConcerns.notes: US produces ~80% of global pecans. Water usage in arid regions (Texas, New Mexico) is a growing concern.

references.section: PMC5827884: Comparison of Oil Content and Fatty Acids Profile of Pecan Nuts

pistachio-oil.name: Pistachio oil
pistachio-oil.description: Oil pressed from pistachios (Pistacia vera). Produces soft bars with highly conditioning properties. Tree nut allergen.

sourcing.productionMethod: Cold-pressed from Pistacia vera nuts.

political: Iranian pistachios subject to trade sanctions in some countries
ethicalConcerns.notes: Iran and California are leading producers. Water scarcity is a concern in both regions. Ongoing conflict in Syria has disrupted production.

references.section: Pistachio oil (CID 6850754)

pork-fat-rendered.name: Lard (all)
pork-fat-rendered.description: Rendered pork fat. Adds moderate hardness with stable, creamy lather.

sourcing.productionMethod: Rendered (wet or dry) from pork adipose tissue.
sourcing.supplyChainNotes: Byproduct of pork processing. China is world's largest pork producer.

environmental: Industrial pork production contributes to water pollution
social: Industrial farming labour conditions vary widely
ethicalConcerns.notes: Not suitable for vegetarian/vegan or halal/kosher products. Sourcing from pasture-raised or certified humane farms addresses some animal welfare concerns.

references.section: CXS 211-1999: Section 2.2 Rendered Pork Fat, Table 1 Fatty Acid Ranges

pork-fat-rendered-pure.name: Lard (leaf)
pork-fat-rendered-pure.description: Rendered pork leaf fat from the visceral area near kidneys and loin. Adds moderate hardness with stable, creamy lather.

sourcing.productionMethod: Rendered from visceral fat deposits (around kidneys and loin).
sourcing.supplyChainNotes: Premium grade lard from specific fat deposits. Often from smaller producers.

environmental: Industrial pork production contributes to water pollution
social: Industrial farming labour conditions vary widely
ethicalConcerns.notes: Not suitable for vegetarian/vegan or halal/kosher products. Leaf lard is often sourced from smaller, heritage breed farms.

references.section: CXS 211-1999: Section 2.1 Lard, Table 1 Fatty Acid Ranges

pumpkin-seed-oil.name: Pumpkin seed oil
pumpkin-seed-oil.description: Oil pressed from pumpkin (Cucurbita pepo) seeds. Produces soft bars with highly conditioning properties. Raw oil is dark green; colour fades significantly in finished soap.

sourcing.productionMethod: Cold-pressed from roasted or raw Cucurbita pepo seeds.
sourcing.supplyChainNotes: Styrian pumpkin seed oil (from Austria/Slovenia) is a protected designation of origin product.

ethicalConcerns.notes: Traditional Central European product. Seeds are often a byproduct of food pumpkin processing.

references.section: PMC6906666: Comparative assessment of physicochemical properties of pumpkin seed oil

rice-bran-oil.name: Rice bran oil
rice-bran-oil.description: Oil extracted from rice (Oryza sativa) bran. Produces soft bars with highly conditioning properties.

sourcing.productionMethod: Solvent-extracted or expeller-pressed from rice bran (outer layer of rice kernel).
sourcing.supplyChainNotes: Byproduct of rice milling. Must be processed quickly due to rapid oxidation of fresh bran.

ethicalConcerns.notes: Sustainable use of rice milling byproduct. Rice paddies contribute to global methane emissions, but bran oil itself uses existing waste.

references.section: CXS 210-1999: Section 2.1.13 Rice Bran Oil, Table 1 Fatty Acid Composition

rosehip-seed-oil.name: Rosehip seed oil
rosehip-seed-oil.description: Oil pressed from rosehip (Rosa canina) seeds. Produces soft bars with highly conditioning properties. High linolenic content; soap prone to DOS.

sourcing.productionMethod: Cold-pressed from Rosa canina (dog rose) or Rosa rubiginosa seeds.

ethicalConcerns.notes: Wild-harvested or cultivated in temperate regions. Chilean rosehip oil is widely exported.

references.section: Rosehip seed oil (CID 6850756)

safflower-oil-high-oleic.name: Safflower oil (high oleic)
safflower-oil-high-oleic.description: Oil pressed from high-oleic safflower (Carthamus tinctorius) seeds. Produces soft bars with highly conditioning properties.

sourcing.productionMethod: Expeller-pressed or solvent-extracted from Carthamus tinctorius seeds.

ethicalConcerns.notes: Drought-tolerant crop suitable for arid regions. High-oleic varieties developed for improved stability.

references.section: CXS 210-1999: Section 2.1.15 Safflowerseed Oil (High Oleic Acid), Table 1

sal-seed-butter.name: Sal seed butter
sal-seed-butter.description: Butter extracted from sal (Shorea robusta) seeds. Produces hard bars with stable, creamy lather.

sourcing.productionMethod: Extracted from Shorea robusta seeds, often using solvent extraction.
sourcing.supplyChainNotes: Seeds collected from natural sal forests, primarily in the Indian subcontinent.

ethicalConcerns.notes: Harvested from natural forests by local communities. Provides income to rural populations in India and Nepal.

references.section: Sal butter / Shorea robusta fat

sea-buckthorn-oil.name: Sea buckthorn oil (fruit)
sea-buckthorn-oil.description: Oil pressed from sea buckthorn (Hippophae rhamnoides) fruit pulp. Adds moderate hardness with conditioning properties.

sourcing.productionMethod: Cold-pressed or CO2-extracted from Hippophae rhamnoides fruit pulp.

ethicalConcerns.notes: Hardy plant that can grow in poor soils and harsh climates. Often cultivated for land restoration.

references.section: PMC3338740: Fatty Acid Composition of Developing Sea Buckthorn (Hippophae rhamnoides L.) Berry and the Transcriptome of the Mature Seed

sesame-oil.name: Sesame oil
sesame-oil.description: Oil pressed from sesame (Sesamum indicum) seeds. Produces soft bars with highly conditioning properties.

sourcing.productionMethod: Cold-pressed or expeller-pressed from Sesamum indicum seeds.

ethicalConcerns.notes: One of the oldest cultivated oil crops. Important smallholder crop in Africa and Asia.

references.section: PMC10292629: Physicochemical and health properties of sesame seed oil: a review

shea-butter.name: Shea butter
shea-butter.description: Butter extracted from shea tree (Vitellaria paradoxa) nuts. Adds moderate hardness with stable, creamy lather.

sourcing.productionMethod: Traditional hand-processing or mechanical extraction from Vitellaria paradoxa nuts.
sourcing.supplyChainNotes: Shea belt spans 21 African countries. Production is largely by women's cooperatives.

environmental: Wild harvesting pressure on shea trees in some areas
Climate change affecting shea tree range
social: Fair compensation for women collectors varies
Middlemen capture significant value in supply chain
ethicalConcerns.notes: Traditional women's trade in West Africa. Fair Trade certification helps ensure better prices reach collectors. Ghana and Burkina Faso are largest exporters.

references.section: CXS 210-1999: Shea Butter specifications in Table 1
PMC10137687: Effect of Refining and Fractionation Processes on Minor Components, Fatty Acids, Antioxidant and Antimicrobial Activities of Shea Butter

sheep-tallow-mutton.name: Sheep tallow (mutton)
sheep-tallow-mutton.description: Rendered sheep fat. Produces hard bars with stable, creamy lather.

sourcing.productionMethod: Rendered from sheep adipose tissue, typically from meat processing.
sourcing.supplyChainNotes: Byproduct of sheep meat industry. Australia and New Zealand are major exporters.

environmental: Sheep farming contributes to methane emissions
ethicalConcerns.notes: Not suitable for vegetarian/vegan products. Pasture-raised and grass-fed sheep have lower environmental impact than feedlot operations.

references.section: CXS 211-1999: Section 2.4 Edible Tallow (includes sheep)

soybean-oil.name: Soybean oil
soybean-oil.description: Oil pressed from soybeans (Glycine max). Produces soft bars with highly conditioning properties. Soy allergen.

sourcing.productionMethod: Solvent-extracted or expeller-pressed from Glycine max seeds.
sourcing.supplyChainNotes: World's most widely produced oilseed. Brazil surpassed US as largest producer.

environmental: Amazon and Cerrado deforestation for soy expansion
social: Land conflicts with indigenous communities in Brazil
Displacement of smallholder farmers
political: Trade disputes and tariffs affect supply chains
ethicalConcerns.notes: Soy is a major driver of deforestation in South America. Most soy goes to animal feed, not direct human consumption. RTRS and ProTerra certifications address deforestation concerns.

references.section: CXS 210-1999: Section 2.1.17 Soyabean Oil, Table 1 Fatty Acid Composition

stearic-acid.name: Stearic acid
stearic-acid.description: Pure stearic fatty acid. Produces very hard bars with stable, creamy lather.

sourcing.productionMethod: Hydrolyzed and fractionated from animal fats (tallow) or vegetable oils (palm, soy).
sourcing.supplyChainNotes: Can be animal or vegetable-derived. Source varies by manufacturer.

environmental: Inherits concerns from source material (palm, tallow, or soy)
ethicalConcerns.notes: Ethical concerns depend entirely on source material. Vegetable-derived stearic acid may come from palm oil (same concerns) or other vegetable sources. Animal-derived comes from tallow.

references.section: CID 5281: Stearic Acid compound summary

sunflower-oil.name: Sunflower oil
sunflower-oil.description: Oil pressed from sunflower (Helianthus annuus) seeds. Produces soft bars with highly conditioning properties.

sourcing.productionMethod: Expeller-pressed or solvent-extracted from Helianthus annuus seeds.

political: Ukraine conflict has disrupted global sunflower oil supply
ethicalConcerns.notes: Ukraine and Russia together produced ~60% of global supply before 2022. War in Ukraine caused major supply disruptions and price increases.

references.section: CXS 210-1999: Section 2.1.18 Sunflowerseed Oil, Table 1 Fatty Acid Composition

sweet-almond-oil.name: Sweet almond oil
sweet-almond-oil.description: Oil pressed from sweet almond (Prunus dulcis) kernels. Produces soft bars with highly conditioning properties. Tree nut allergen.

sourcing.productionMethod: Cold-pressed or expeller-pressed from Prunus dulcis kernels.

environmental: California almond production is highly water-intensive
ethicalConcerns.notes: California produces ~80% of global almonds. High water usage in drought-prone regions and heavy reliance on commercial bee pollination are significant concerns.

references.section: Amygdalae oleum raffinatum monograph
Variability of Oil Content and Major Fatty Acid Composition in Almond

tamanu-oil.name: Tamanu oil
tamanu-oil.description: Oil pressed from tamanu (Calophyllum inophyllum) nuts. Produces soft bars with conditioning properties. Raw oil has strong nutty scent; mostly dissipates during saponification.

sourcing.productionMethod: Cold-pressed from dried Calophyllum inophyllum nuts after curing.
sourcing.supplyChainNotes: Traditional Polynesian medicine. Nuts require curing before oil extraction.

ethicalConcerns.notes: Wild-harvested in Pacific islands. Supports traditional livelihoods in island communities. Tamanu trees are coastal and help prevent erosion.

references.section: Tamanu oil / Calophyllum inophyllum oil (CID 6850760)

walnut-oil.name: Walnut oil
walnut-oil.description: Oil pressed from walnuts (Juglans regia). Produces soft bars with highly conditioning properties. Tree nut allergen.

sourcing.productionMethod: Cold-pressed or expeller-pressed from Juglans regia kernels.

ethicalConcerns.notes: China produces ~50% of global walnuts. California is second largest producer and faces water scarcity challenges.

references.section: Oil, walnut (FDC ID 173582)

wheat-germ-oil.name: Wheat germ oil
wheat-germ-oil.description: Oil pressed from wheat (Triticum aestivum) germ. Produces soft bars with highly conditioning properties. High polyunsaturated content; soap may be prone to DOS.

sourcing.productionMethod: Cold-pressed or solvent-extracted from wheat germ, a byproduct of flour milling.
sourcing.supplyChainNotes: Byproduct of wheat flour production. Germ represents only ~2.5% of kernel weight.

ethicalConcerns.notes: Sustainable use of wheat milling byproduct. Highly perishable due to polyunsaturated fat content.

references.section: Oil, wheat germ (FDC ID 172354)
